alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 11:30AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Carbon, Albany, northwestern Laramie, western Platte and southern Converse Counties through NOON MDT... At 1129 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles south of Powder River to 9 miles northwest of Battle Mountain to Brooklyn Lake Campground. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Douglas, Albany, Glenrock, Saratoga, Hanna, Encampment, Rolling Hills, Sinclair, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Rolling Hills Estates, Battle Mountain, Grand Encampment, Esterbrook, Friend Park Campground, Deer Creek, Horse Creek and Rob Roy Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 124 and 175. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 220 and 316. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
